DIRECTOR FACILITIES PLANNING, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION
Executive Profile
A leader working in a large integrated academic medical center (www.uwhealth.org) focused on integrated business planning and facility design and development driven by operational improvement and teamwork.
Experienced in all aspects of facility support and construction.
Skill Highlights
Health care business planning Experience in all aspects of health care support services Team leader in process improvement combined with facility design Full design, construction and implementation planning for new hospital development Management of integrated staff of design and construction professionals
Boundary spanning professional Management of large capital budgets Contract development and negotiation for multiple project delivery methods Hospital acquisition due diligence Integrated facility planning across multiple organizations
Core Accomplishments
UW Health at the American Center - Fifty bed orthopedic hospital with integrated clinics, and health and wellness center. 500,000 square feet, August 2015 opening American Family Children's Hospital - Eighty bed full service pediatric hospital with NICU, PICU and Pediatric Oncology.
Full complement of outpatient services including imaging center, 280,000 square feet, 2007 opening with an additional vertical expansion of 54,000 square feet (www.uwhealthkids.org) UW Health Rehab Hospital - Fifty beds to support the orthopedic hospital, September 2015 opening Integrated design and construction management departments to increase economies of scale and increase customer responsiveness professionalism Managed over $1 billion in construction projects

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

<JD_START>
Job Title: Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction

Location: Blauvelt, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Management

Description:
This position is posted on behalf of People Solutions Center's client, Ascape Landscape and Construction. Ascape Landscape and Construction Corporation is seeking a Service Manager to oversee the administration of our snow removal and maintenance efforts.  Our Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction will play an essential role in the day-to-day operations of our maintenance and snow removal divisions.  About Us:Ascape Landscape and Construction Corporation was founded in 1984. We are a commercial and residential landscape construction and maintenance business with an established reputation for service and quality. We believe in focusing on success and providing a best-in-class landscape services to our clients across the New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, and Pennsylvania area. Why work for Ascape Landscape and Construction as our Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal?  We offer a robust compensation and benefits package for this role, with a yearly starting salary of $65,000 per year with opportunity for growth. We also offer health benefits after 90 days, and a 401k with a 4% employer match, paid time off, and vacation time. Our Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal will have a Monday-Friday schedule from approximately 8am to 5pm. Requirements for the Service Manager - Maintenance and Snow Removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction: 3-5 years of experience working in office administration in a related industry such as construction, landscaping, plumbing, electric etc… A High School Diploma/GED required; an associates or higher is preferred Intermediate/proficient experience in Excel Basic technical knowledge and the ability to sit behind a computer for 8 hours Excellent written, verbal, and auditory communication skillsExcellent attention to detail with large and small amounts of dataProficient with using technology including CRM, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Outlook, and AdobeJob Duties for the Service Manager – Maintenance and Snow Removal at Ascape Landscape and Construction: Scheduling appointments with customers for technician visits and coordinating as a liaison between customers and technicians Tracking all technician schedules Building proposals for the Operations Manager to review Managing client relationships including handling client complaints and resolving client issues in coordination with the Operations Manager Accounts Receivables for maintenance and snow removal projects including entering client payment information and tracking billing and invoicing on client accountsCoordinating payments and deposits with the bookkeeping department Collecting work orders from technicians and entering job times and work order details into the systemActing as a back up for phone system; answering phone calls from maintenance and snow removal customersOther duties as assigned

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
